title: (x) 2006 Burton Snowboard Catalog - Blender {Dav}
content:
I’m sure I know this but can’t put my finger on, probably something very obvious but I’m stuck, any suggestions?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [burtonbodytext.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/typophile.com/files/burtonbodytext.jpg) | 105.81 KB |

 [‹ (x) First Republic Bank serif face - Adobe Garamond {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29102 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "this way brouwn" geometric sans - Neuzeit Grotesk (Geometric 706) {Skylar Fein} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29082 "Go to next forum topic")
author: LMcat

comments.content: i fixed it. the attachment is showing up now...
Looks quite like one of the Font Font Magda’s, but not quite
It’s not Monoline, though very close.
Can anybody shed any light on this typeface (I’m LMcat at work), thanks

’ [Blender](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/www.die-gestalten.de/fonts/detail/?id=402881820693de75010693de940a000f)’, by Nik Thoenen..

_( And, Sorry for the delay.. I know, I am getting slower every day.. :)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/www.formlos.net/)
thanks formlos, Blender is actually new to me so I’m glad you’ve helped me out.

( And, Sorry for the delay.. I know, I am getting slower every day.. :)

There should be a law against being that good... :^P

Whoa!? What’s [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/www.die-gestalten.de/fonts/detail/?id=402881820693de75010693dea8c30071)? And [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/www.die-gestalten.de/fonts/detail/?id=402881820693de75010693deb83000be)!?

Somebody’d better call [Matthew Carter](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=LH.6085.0.0) and [Magnus Rakeng](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607003545/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Radio/mudTyper+Weights/)... :^/
Did someone call them? Pemba is a clear Radio knockoff.
I believe Sir Village has commented on that before. Instead of Matthew, I’d contact Linotype.
